applicable_requirements.text: The project shall define and record the licensing basis and code-of-record for the valve, including applicable regulations, incorporated codes/standards, and edition/addenda where required.

verification.acceptance: Documented licensing basis and code-of-record exists and is under configuration control.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve’s safety function(s), required position(s) for each analyzed event, and success criteria shall be explicitly defined.

verification.acceptance: Safety function(s), positions, and success criteria are documented and traceable to the design basis.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall be classified (code class, safety classification, seismic category, QA level) using the project’s approved classification methodology.

verification.acceptance: Classification is documented, reviewed, approved, and traceable to project methodology.

applicable_requirements.text: Design inputs for normal, transient, and accident conditions applicable to the valve shall be defined, including pressure, temperature, differential pressure, flow, and environmental conditions.

verification.acceptance: Controlled design-input set exists and is referenced by calculations/specifications.

applicable_requirements.text: The project shall define the bounding transient and accident scenarios that govern valve operability and integrity (including required duty cycles and timing requirements).

verification.acceptance: Bounding scenarios and governing cases are documented and linked to requirements.

applicable_requirements.text: Interfaces to piping, supports, electrical power, control signals, and instrumentation shall be defined in controlled interface documents or drawings.

verification.acceptance: Interface definitions exist, are consistent across disciplines, and are under document control.

applicable_requirements.text: System-level constraints that affect the valve (e.g., water hammer limits, allowable closure times, thermal stratification constraints) shall be captured as design inputs.

verification.acceptance: Constraints are documented and referenced by the valve specification and analyses.

applicable_requirements.text: The project shall define and control credited setpoints/limits (e.g., stroke time, seat leakage, relief setpoint, position indication needs) for the valve.

verification.acceptance: Setpoints/limits are documented with justification and are under configuration control.

applicable_requirements.text: A verification plan shall be established that maps each valve requirement to a verification method (test, analysis, inspection, or demonstration) and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Requirements-to-verification mapping exists and includes measurable acceptance criteria.

applicable_requirements.text: Assumptions, TBD/TBR items, and required engineering inputs for the valve shall be tracked with defined owners and closure criteria.

verification.acceptance: Assumption/TBD log exists and closure criteria are defined and managed.

applicable_requirements.text: Design reviews for the valve specification and design outputs shall be performed and documented commensurate with the valve’s safety classification.

verification.acceptance: Review records demonstrate independent review and approval per QA procedures.

applicable_requirements.text: A requirements traceability matrix shall be maintained that links valve requirements to design basis sources and verification evidence.

verification.acceptance: Traceability exists from requirement to source and to verification evidence.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve specification shall be placed under configuration control before procurement/fabrication begins, and released revisions shall be uniquely identified.

verification.acceptance: Controlled revision exists; release and revision history are auditable.

applicable_requirements.text: Changes to valve requirements, design inputs, setpoints, or qualification basis shall be evaluated for impact and controlled through the project change control process.

verification.acceptance: Change evaluations are documented and demonstrate impact assessment and approvals.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve pressure boundary shall be designed, fabricated, examined, and tested in accordance with the applicable code class and code-of-record requirements.

verification.acceptance: Design and manufacturing records demonstrate code compliance to the defined code-of-record.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall be rated for the specified design pressure and design temperature, including applicable transients and design margins defined by the design basis.

verification.acceptance: Ratings and analyses demonstrate capability at design conditions.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve assembly shall withstand combined loads from pressure, thermal gradients, piping reactions, and operational loads without loss of pressure boundary integrity.

verification.acceptance: Structural evaluation demonstrates allowable limits are met for governing load combinations.

applicable_requirements.text: If classified as Seismic Category I (or equivalent), the valve pressure boundary shall maintain integrity for the seismic load combinations defined by the seismic design basis.

verification.acceptance: Seismic evaluation/qualification demonstrates integrity for credited seismic conditions.

applicable_requirements.text: Thermal transients and thermal distortion effects shall be evaluated to prevent binding, loss of operability, or unacceptable stresses.

verification.acceptance: Thermal evaluation demonstrates operability and acceptable stress limits for governing transients.

applicable_requirements.text: Bolted joints and gaskets shall be designed to maintain leak-tightness under all applicable load combinations, including thermal and seismic loads as applicable.

verification.acceptance: Joint design and assembly controls demonstrate leak-tightness capability.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve stem/shaft retention design shall prevent stem blowout or ejection under design pressure and loading.

verification.acceptance: Design features prevent blowout; verified by drawing review and/or analysis.

applicable_requirements.text: Body-to-bonnet (or equivalent pressure boundary closure) design shall prevent separation under design pressure and external loads.

verification.acceptance: Analysis demonstrates positive retention and adequate margin under design loads.

applicable_requirements.text: Pressure boundary wall thickness shall include allowances appropriate for manufacturing tolerances and anticipated degradation mechanisms for the specified service life.

verification.acceptance: Wall thickness basis is documented and meets defined margins for service life.

applicable_requirements.text: Weld-end and flange-end configurations (as applicable) shall be compatible with the piping design basis and shall maintain required weld preparations and flange facing requirements.

verification.acceptance: Interface dimensions and preparation requirements are specified and verified on drawings.

applicable_requirements.text: Non-destructive examination (NDE) requirements for pressure boundary materials and welds shall be specified and performed to acceptance criteria commensurate with code class.

verification.acceptance: NDE procedures, personnel qualifications, and results meet specified acceptance criteria.

applicable_requirements.text: Pressure boundary testing (hydrostatic and/or pneumatic) shall be performed with defined test pressure, hold time, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Recorded test results meet acceptance criteria with no unacceptable leakage or deformation.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall withstand the maximum specified differential pressure {{dp_max}} without structural damage or permanent deformation that impairs function.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation demonstrates structural integrity and operability at dp_max.

applicable_requirements.text: External leakage paths (packing, body joints, plugs) shall be controlled such that leakage remains within defined limits under applicable conditions.

verification.acceptance: Leakage test results meet defined limits for governing conditions.

applicable_requirements.text: If a backseat (or equivalent) feature is provided and credited, it shall maintain function under applicable loads and conditions and shall not compromise pressure boundary integrity.

verification.acceptance: Backseat function is demonstrated under defined conditions when credited.

applicable_requirements.text: Potential flow-induced vibration and resonance effects for the valve body and internals shall be evaluated when operating conditions could induce damaging vibration.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation identifies vibration risks and documents mitigations if needed.

applicable_requirements.text: Each valve shall have a durable nameplate/marking including unique identifier, size/rating, materials (as required), and manufacturer information to support traceability.

verification.acceptance: Marking meets specification and supports unique identification and traceability.

applicable_requirements.text: End connections and interface dimensions shall be compatible with the specified piping interface standard(s) and installation configuration.

verification.acceptance: Interface drawings/specs match piping design requirements.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve face-to-face (or end-to-end) dimensions and orientation constraints shall be specified to support plant layout and maintenance access.

verification.acceptance: Valve envelope and dimensions match layout requirements.

applicable_requirements.text: Allowable piping reaction loads at the valve nozzles/end connections shall be specified and verified to be compatible with the piping stress design.

verification.acceptance: Allowables are documented; piping loads are within allowables.

applicable_requirements.text: Support, anchor, and restraint requirements for the valve and actuator assembly shall be specified, including any installation-specific bracing required.

verification.acceptance: Support/anchor requirements are documented and consistent with structural/piping design.

applicable_requirements.text: Clearances and access envelopes required for operation, inspection, and maintenance shall be defined (including handwheel swing, actuator removal clearance, and tooling access).

verification.acceptance: Defined envelopes support intended maintenance and testing tasks.

applicable_requirements.text: Handling, lifting, shipping, and storage constraints (including preservation and allowable orientations) shall be specified and provided with the valve documentation package.

verification.acceptance: Handling/shipping/storage requirements are documented and provided.

applicable_requirements.text: Pressure boundary materials shall be specified, traceable to certified material test reports (CMTRs), and controlled to prevent substitution.

verification.acceptance: Material traceability is demonstrated from heat/lot to installed item.

applicable_requirements.text: Materials in contact with primary coolant shall be compatible with specified coolant chemistry and operating temperature to prevent unacceptable corrosion, SCC, erosion, or embrittlement over service life.

verification.acceptance: Materials selection rationale demonstrates compatibility for the defined environment and life.

applicable_requirements.text: Material selection shall consider susceptibility to stress corrosion cracking and irradiation-assisted degradation for the expected environment and exposure, and document the basis for selection.

verification.acceptance: Documented evaluation supports material selection for expected environment and life.

applicable_requirements.text: Valve trim and hardfacing materials shall be selected to minimize galling, wear, and erosion under the specified duty and differential pressure conditions.

verification.acceptance: Trim/hardfacing selection is justified and meets duty requirements.

applicable_requirements.text: Lubricants and assembly compounds shall be compatible with service temperature, radiation, and coolant chemistry, and shall not introduce unacceptable contamination to the primary system.

verification.acceptance: Specified lubricants are documented and verified in procurement and assembly records.

applicable_requirements.text: Cleanliness requirements for fabrication, assembly, shipping, storage, and installation shall be defined to prevent introduction of foreign material to the primary system.

verification.acceptance: Cleaning and packaging controls are documented and verified by records.

applicable_requirements.text: Foreign material exclusion (FME) controls shall be applied during valve assembly, testing, packaging, and installation as required by the primary system cleanliness program.

verification.acceptance: FME controls are documented and verifiable by records and inspections.

applicable_requirements.text: Sealing surfaces and critical seating areas shall have specified surface finish and dimensional tolerances appropriate to achieve the required leakage limits.

verification.acceptance: Surface finish/tolerances are specified and verified by inspection records.

applicable_requirements.text: Coatings, paints, or platings (if used) shall be compatible with expected temperature/radiation and shall not flake or degrade in a manner that creates foreign material risk.

verification.acceptance: Coating selection is justified; inspection verifies compliance.

applicable_requirements.text: Welding filler materials, heat treatment, and welding procedures for pressure boundary welds shall be controlled and traceable commensurate with the code class.

verification.acceptance: WPS/PQR, welder qualifications, and filler traceability are documented and controlled.

applicable_requirements.text: Dissimilar metal interfaces shall be evaluated for galvanic corrosion risk and mitigated as necessary for the service environment.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation identifies corrosion risk and documents mitigations when needed.

applicable_requirements.text: Storage preservation requirements (e.g., end caps, desiccant, corrosion inhibitors, periodic inspection) shall be specified to prevent degradation prior to installation.

verification.acceptance: Preservation requirements are documented and verified by storage/receiving records.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall perform its defined function (isolation, flow control, non-return, or overpressure protection) under all credited operating modes and design-basis conditions.

verification.acceptance: Functional performance is demonstrated for defined scenarios and acceptance criteria.

applicable_requirements.text: For isolation valves, the valve shall achieve and maintain isolation consistent with the specified seat leakage limit {{seat_leakage_limit}} under defined bounding conditions.

verification.acceptance: Seat leakage is <= seat_leakage_limit for defined test conditions.

applicable_requirements.text: For isolation or control valves, the valve shall achieve the required position(s) within the specified stroke time limit {{stroke_time_limit}} under bounding differential pressure and environmental conditions.

verification.acceptance: Measured stroke time meets stroke_time_limit for bounding conditions.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall operate without binding, galling, or loss of operability across the specified differential pressure range up to {{dp_max}}.

verification.acceptance: Operability is demonstrated across required dp range and temperatures.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve flow capacity (Cv/Kv or equivalent) shall meet system flow requirements up to {{flowrate_max}} with pressure drop and noise/vibration within allowable limits defined by the design basis.

verification.acceptance: Flow capacity and pressure drop meet design requirements; adverse effects are within allowable limits.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall maintain the required position under flow-induced and hydraulic forces without unintended movement or self-actuation.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation demonstrates no unintended movement under bounding forces.

applicable_requirements.text: For manual valves credited in procedures or safety functions, required operating torque at bounding differential pressure shall be within specified human factors limits or a gear operator shall be provided.

verification.acceptance: Measured/estimated operating torque meets limits or gear operator is provided and verified.

applicable_requirements.text: Wear and aging effects (packing wear, seat wear, stem friction increase) shall be considered in performance margins and maintenance planning for credited functions.

verification.acceptance: Performance margins account for aging; maintenance plan addresses degradation mechanisms.

applicable_requirements.text: Where mispositioning risk exists, the valve shall include locking, sealing, or administrative provisions to prevent inadvertent operation inconsistent with credited configuration.

verification.acceptance: Locking/sealing/procedural controls are specified and verifiable.

applicable_requirements.text: If classified as Seismic Category I (or equivalent), the valve assembly shall maintain its required safety function following the safe-shutdown earthquake (SSE) per the defined seismic design basis.

verification.acceptance: Qualification evidence demonstrates post-SSE operability and structural integrity for credited functions.

applicable_requirements.text: The seismic qualification approach (test, analysis, or experience data) shall be documented, including test spectra, input assumptions, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Qualification approach and assumptions are documented and controlled.

applicable_requirements.text: The seismic qualification boundary shall include the valve, actuator, mounting hardware, supports/brackets, and accessories necessary for credited function.

verification.acceptance: Boundary is defined and matches as-installed configuration.

applicable_requirements.text: Seismic interaction concerns (including potential impact, falling hazards, and spatial clearances) shall be evaluated for the valve location when required by the design basis.

verification.acceptance: Evaluation documents interactions and mitigations where required.

applicable_requirements.text: For non-safety valves, seismic and environmental requirements shall be specified commensurate with their credited function and classification, and shall not reduce the capability of nearby safety-related equipment.

verification.acceptance: Requirements are specified and demonstrate no adverse impact on safety-related equipment.

applicable_requirements.text: An acceptance test plan shall be defined that demonstrates pressure boundary integrity and functional performance against specified acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Test plan includes required tests, conditions, instrumentation, and measurable acceptance criteria.

applicable_requirements.text: Factory acceptance testing shall include pressure boundary testing (hydrostatic and/or pneumatic) with defined test pressure, hold time, and acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: Recorded results meet acceptance criteria with no unacceptable leakage or deformation.

applicable_requirements.text: Factory acceptance testing shall include seat leakage testing under defined conditions that bound credited service conditions.

verification.acceptance: Seat leakage results meet seat_leakage_limit under defined test conditions.

applicable_requirements.text: Factory acceptance testing shall include an external leakage check (packing and body joints) at pressure/temperature conditions defined by the test plan.

verification.acceptance: External leakage meets defined acceptance limits; results are recorded.

applicable_requirements.text: Functional open/close operation shall be demonstrated during testing under representative differential pressure where practical or by justified alternative testing/analysis.

verification.acceptance: Functional operation is demonstrated for defined conditions with acceptance criteria met.

applicable_requirements.text: Non-destructive examinations (NDE) required by the code-of-record or specification shall be performed using qualified procedures and personnel, and results shall meet acceptance criteria.

verification.acceptance: NDE records demonstrate qualified procedures/personnel and acceptable results.

applicable_requirements.text: Test instrumentation used for acceptance tests (pressure, flow, time, torque/thrust, electrical parameters) shall be calibrated and traceable to a controlled calibration program.

verification.acceptance: Calibration certificates and traceability are available and current.

applicable_requirements.text: Test anomalies, failures, and nonconformances shall be dispositioned under the corrective action/nonconformance process, including retest when required to demonstrate compliance.

verification.acceptance: Nonconformance records include disposition and retest evidence where required.

applicable_requirements.text: Procurement documents shall specify applicable technical, QA, inspection, test, documentation, and records requirements for the valve and critical subcomponents.

verification.acceptance: Procurement package includes required flowdowns and acceptance criteria.

applicable_requirements.text: Nonconformances affecting valve requirements or qualification basis shall be documented, evaluated for operability/impact, and dispositioned per QA procedures.

verification.acceptance: Nonconformance disposition includes impact evaluation and acceptance rationale.

applicable_requirements.text: Unique identification and traceability shall be maintained from procurement through installation, including traceability of pressure boundary materials and critical parts.

verification.acceptance: Traceability is demonstrated by unique IDs and records linking to critical parts/materials.

applicable_requirements.text: Document control shall ensure only current, approved revisions of drawings, specifications, procedures, and instructions are used for fabrication, installation, and testing.

verification.acceptance: Document control audits show current revisions in use and obsolete versions controlled.

applicable_requirements.text: Final acceptance of the installed valve shall include verification that the installed configuration matches the approved design basis, including settings, orientation, and required documentation.

verification.acceptance: Installation acceptance checklist demonstrates compliance with approved configuration and requirements.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve installation shall provide adequate physical access for required surveillance, maintenance, inspection, packing adjustment, lubrication, and repair activities.

verification.acceptance: Access provisions meet defined maintenance/inspection needs.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve design and installation shall support safe isolation, lockout/tagout, and restoration consistent with plant maintenance practices and credited configurations.

verification.acceptance: Isolation and lockout/tagout provisions are documented and feasible.

applicable_requirements.text: Valve orientation and actuator placement shall be specified to avoid installation conditions that could impair function (e.g., trapped gas/air, unfavorable gravity effects for check valves) where applicable.

verification.acceptance: Installation orientation requirements are documented and verified.

applicable_requirements.text: Valve opening/closing characteristics (including closure time and damping features if used) shall be compatible with system dynamic constraints such as water hammer and piping loads.

verification.acceptance: System dynamics evaluation demonstrates acceptable loads and operation.

applicable_requirements.text: Design features and procedures shall minimize maintenance-induced foreign material intrusion (e.g., protective caps, cleanliness controls, controlled disassembly).

verification.acceptance: Provisions and procedures are documented and support cleanliness controls.

applicable_requirements.text: A recommended spare parts list and preventive maintenance guidance shall be provided commensurate with safety classification and expected degradation mechanisms.

verification.acceptance: Spare parts and maintenance guidance are provided and reviewed for adequacy.

applicable_requirements.text: The valve shall include clear and durable local labeling for valve identification, flow direction (if applicable), and local open/close indications consistent with procedures.

verification.acceptance: Labeling is present, legible, durable, and consistent with procedures/drawings.

applicable_requirements.text: For manual operation interfaces (handwheels/levers/gear operators), required forces/torques and accessibility shall be compatible with operational needs, including during abnormal conditions when credited.

verification.acceptance: Forces/torques and accessibility meet specified limits and are verified.

applicable_requirements.text: Where practicable, the design shall support replacement of wear parts (packing, seats, seals) with minimal impact to adjacent safety-related equipment and without violating cleanliness controls.

verification.acceptance: Maintainability approach is documented and supports planned tasks.
